intro: Loreya arborescens, commonly known as the tree morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Loreya arborescens is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering vines and herbs.
